Instrument Description: The Cardiopulmonary Bypass (CPB) Machine is a medical device that temporarily takes over the function of the heart and lungs during cardiac surgery. Instrument Description: Aortic and Venous Cannulas are tubes inserted into the aorta and vena cava, respectively, during cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB). Instrument Uses: Aortic cannula: Inserted into the ascending aorta to deliver oxygenated blood from the CPB machine back into the systemic circulation. Venous cannula: Inserted into the vena cava (superior and/or inferior) to drain deoxygenated blood from the body into the CPB machine. These cannulas establish the connection between the patient's circulatory system and the CPB circuit.
